page.title: 13GRAND WESTERN CANAL
page.content: The Grand Western Canal is a most interesting "countryside Park"which goes through the middle of our area. It was originally designed as a short cut to link the Bristol Channel to the English Channel in the late 18th century,but the original plan had to be abandoned and we are left with the only branch that was ever completed. It fell into disrepair and was only rescued in the 1960's.The western section nearer to Tiverton is used by boats but our section of the canal is kept as a nature reserve and boats are not allowed.The maintenance of the canal is carried out by Devon County Council and a team of men work full time in order to preserve and maintain its structure and surroundings.
